body_html:
@zou3519 I don't think this issue is specific to add; For example variants of mul have the same behavior:

>>> a=Variable(torch.randn(2,3))
>>> torch.mul(input=a, value=100)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: descriptor 'mul' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' object needs an argument
>>> torch.mul(input=a, other=100)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: descriptor 'mul' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' object needs an argument

body:
@zou3519  I don't think this issue is specific to `add`; For example variants of `mul` have the same behavior:
```
>>> a=Variable(torch.randn(2,3))
>>> torch.mul(input=a, value=100)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: descriptor 'mul' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' object needs an argument
>>> torch.mul(input=a, other=100)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: descriptor 'mul' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' object needs an argument
```
